<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bc4c505166dc82911553206bb0c2133c6ac94aa1|patch 8.2.1444: error messages are spread out and names can be confusing>
patch 8.2.1444: error messages are spread out and names can be confusing

Problem:    Error messages are spread out and names can be confusing.
Solution:   Start moving error messages to a separate file and use clear
            names.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/cdd70f09a5340c3d7ae873f1aaaf9847f27410cc|patch 8.2.1443: Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function>
patch 8.2.1443: Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function

Problem:    Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function.
Solution:   Push a dummy return value onto the stack. (closes #6701)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1443: Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function · vim/vim@cdd70f0
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1443: Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function · vim/vim@cdd70f0
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when interrupting a nested :def function. Solution: Push a dummy return value onto the stack. (closes #6701)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c771908681bc9ee7689d83e09104cf4c6f984326|patch 8.2.1441: running tests in tiny version gives error for summari…>
patch 8.2.1441: running tests in tiny version gives error for summarize.vim

Problem:    Running tests in tiny version gives error for summarize.vim.
Solution:   Set 'cpoptions' to allow for line continuation.  Restore
            redirecting test output to /dev/null.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b96a32ef1a95dd4ebf9413d686bccb1b4645f74b|patch 8.2.1439: tiny and small builds have no test coverage>
patch 8.2.1439: tiny and small builds have no test coverage

Problem:    Tiny and small builds have no test coverage.
Solution:   Restore tests that do not depend on the +eval feature.
            (Ken Takata, closes #6696)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1439: tiny and small builds have no test coverage · vim/vim@b96a32e

attachments.text: Problem: Tiny and small builds have no test coverage. Solution: Restore tests that do not depend on the +eval feature. (Ken Takata, closes #6696)
